question_text: Which electrical characteristic of RS232 signaling makes it more vulnerable to noise over long distances?
answer_options: It uses single-ended signaling with large voltage swings
It is wireless and reflects ambient radio waves
correct_answer: It uses single-ended signaling with large voltage swings
explanation: RS232 uses single-ended signaling (not differential), making it more susceptible to electrical noise and signal degradation across long runs.
